description:
Just peachy on it’s own

Grow your own sweet, juicy peaches with this self-pollinating backyard tree.

Red Haven produces abundant golden-red peaches that easily separate from the pit, perfect for fresh eating or canning. Its compact size makes harvesting easy, and since it's self-pollinating, you only need one tree to get fruit. Plus, natural disease resistance means less maintenance throughout the season.

sections.product_features:
Compact fruiting peach tree
Easy to maintain—disease resistant
Grows in hardiness zones 5-8
Handles cold down to -15°F
Perfect for home gardens and yards
Produces freestone peaches in 3-4 years
Harvest mid to late summer

Dig hole twice as wide as roots

Water deeply and regularly
Mulch to retain moisture

sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Yard Advisors:
How do I store bare root trees before planting?
Plant within 24 hours of delivery. If needed, store briefly in a cool, dark place with roots wrapped in moist (not wet) newspaper. Learn more on how to care for new bare root plants (https://www.getsunday.com/shed/garden/how-to-care-for-new-bare-root-plants)
What size will my tree be at planting?
Your bare root tree arrives at 3-4 feet tall, ready for planting.
What growing zone do I need?
For best results, plant in zones 5-8.
How long until my tree produces fruit?
Trees typically begin producing fruit in 3-4 years, with full harvests by year 5.
Do I need another peach tree nearby?
No, Red Haven is self-pollinating, though a second tree can increase yields.
